name: Intro to Economics
description: This course introduces students to the basics of economics, including supply and demand, economic systems, and economic indicators.

name: Intermediate Microeconomics
description: This course covers more advanced topics in microeconomics, such as game theory, producer theory, and market structure.

name: Intermediate Macroeconomics
description: This course covers more advanced topics in macroeconomics, such as economic growth, fiscal and monetary policy, and international economics.

name: Econometrics I
description: This course introduces students to basic econometric techniques, including linear regression, least squares, and hypothesis testing.

name: Econometrics II
description: This course covers more advanced topics in econometrics, such as time series analysis, panel data analysis, and non-linear regression.
